com.inqwell.any

Class AnyMessageFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.text.Format
      • com.inqwell.any.MessageFormat
        • com.inqwell.any.AnyMessageFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable

    public class AnyMessageFormat
extends MessageFormat
    This is a version of the standard java.text.MessageFormat class to support strings parameterised by Any values. The original functionality is unchanged except that the necessary methods are overridden to ensure that instances of AnyFormat are installed where appropriate. TBD - toPattern needs to be overridden should this be requiredas the base class relies on the java.text concrete types to re-create the pattern and accesses the private array of formatters to do it.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setFormat

        public void setFormat(int i,
                      Format f)
        Description copied from class: MessageFormat
        Set a format to be used on a variable in the pattern.
        Overrides:
        setFormat in class MessageFormat
        Parameters:
        i - the zero-based number of the variable in the format. This is not the argument number. If variable is out of range, an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
        f - the format to use for the specified variable
